intro: Phlogacanthus celebicus, commonly known as the Celebes spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
